segments.title: Area Under Curve Explanation
segments.summary: The segment explains how the area under a velocity-time curve represents the total distance traveled. It emphasizes how this seemingly complex idea of summing tiny rectangles approaches a simple concept of area under the curve.

segments.title: Area Approximation Method
segments.summary: Explains how better approximations of the original problem correspond to collections of rectangles whose total area approaches the area under the curve. This represents the precise distance traveled for a varying velocity function.

segments.title: Negative Area Concept
segments.summary: Discusses how areas below the horizontal axis are counted as negative in integrals. Explains that integrals measure signed area rather than just area between the graph and horizontal axis.

segments.title: Area Under Graph Visualization
segments.summary: Explains how the area under a velocity graph between two time points represents the distance traveled during that period. Shows how this concept can be understood through rectangle approximations.

segments.title: Basic Area Concept
segments.summary: Introduces how distance can be visualized as area on a velocity-time graph, where the product of velocity and time naturally corresponds to meters traveled.
